humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 2.5 x 2.2 cm, which falls in the T2 category of being more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this report is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size is 2.2 x 0: x 2.5 cm, which falls within the T2 category (tumor size more than 2cm not more than 5 cm). The report also mentions that the tumor is an infiltrating duct carcinoma, G2, and the specimen type is a radical mastectomy. The T stage is determined based on the size of the tumor, and in this case, it is T2.
